snippet: Michael Bradley transferred from Roma, of Italy’s Serie A, to Toronto F.C., of Major League Soccer — a move that subverted the conventional definition of success for an American soccer player.
abstract: Michael Bradley transferred from Roma, of Italy’s Serie A, to Toronto FC, of Major League Soccer in move that subverts the conventional definition of success for an American soccer player; with the World Cup six months away, it invites speculation on what larger meaning it might have for the American team.
lead_paragraph: Michael Bradley transferred from Roma, of Italy’s Serie A, to Toronto F.C., of Major League Soccer — a move that subverted the conventional definition of success for an American soccer player.

headline.main: Seeking Bigger Role, Bradley Invests His Future in M.L.S.
headline.print_headline: Seeking Bigger Role, Bradley Invests His Future in M.L.S.

keywords.value: United States Men's National Soccer Team
